task_summary: Detect the fridge door, approach and grasp the handle/edge, pull to open the hinged door, then retreat and release.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 robot opens a small refrigerator. The camera shows the fridge frontally with a bar-like edge/handle on the right side. The robot first perceives the door, approaches the handle region, aligns the end-effector, grasps, and pulls to swing the hinged door open. Once open, the interior shelves become visible. The sequence emphasizes reliable perception, stable grasp, and a smooth pulling motion followed by a short retreat and release to avoid recontact. Timeouts are moderate to account for manipulation and door inertia.
preconditions: Robot base is positioned within reach of the fridge door
Manipulator is free and gripper operational
Fridge door is initially closed or ajar
Scene lighting sufficient for visual detection
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and move to a pregrasp near the handle/edge
Align precisely to the handle region
Close gripper to secure the edge/handle
Optionally yaw wrist to a pulling orientation
Open the container (hinged door) by pulling
success_criteria: Door angle increases so interior shelves are visible
Robot ends clear of the swinging door with no collisions
failure_and_recovery: If alignment fails, re-approach with precise tolerance
If grasp is unstable, reopen gripper and repeat approach
If door resists, extend open duration then retreat and retry
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the door is confirmed open and the robot has retreated and released.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper is in contact with the door edge; grasp is being secured.
frame_3.predicts_next: Pull motion to open the hinged door is expected.

node_specs.description: Open gripper to clear approach / release at end.
Move to a pregrasp near the handle/edge.
Close gripper to secure the door edge/handle.
Check if the door is already open.
Back off to avoid collision with the open door.
Short pause to stabilize end state.

failure_modes: Robot collides with door edge during pull
recovery_strategy: Re-open gripper and re-approach with precise tolerance
Increase pull duration within allowed timeout bins
assumptions: The fridge opens via a right-side hinged door; using 'hinged_door' fits the visuals
Handle/edge is graspable; exact handle type not specified
SetTCPYaw=90 provides a better pulling orientation though not explicitly visible in every frame
